channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Coronavirus delays Russian vote on Putin staying in power
item.description: A public ballot on constitutional change is postponed because of coronavirus concerns.

item.title: Coronavirus: Spain’s death toll surpasses China’s
item.description: The death toll from coronavirus in Spain is now the second highest in the world at 3,434.

item.title: Coronavirus: Senate agrees $1.8tn stimulus package with Trump
item.description: The deal to alleviate the economic impact of coronavirus on the US is worth more than $1.8 trillion.

item.title: Coronavirus: Jordan eases indefinite curfew and allows shops to open
item.description: The country had imposed some of the most restrictive measures seen to combat the coronavirus.

item.title: Jamal Khashoggi: Turkey charges 20 Saudis over journalist's murder
item.description: Journalist Jamal Khashoggi was murdered inside the Saudi consulate in Istanbul in October 2018.

item.title: Afghanistan conflict: Militants in deadly attack on Sikh temple in Kabul
item.description: At least 25 people are killed in an attack on a packed gurdwara by Islamic State militants.

item.title: Cho Ju-bin: South Korea chatroom sex abuse suspect named after outcry
item.description: At least 10,000 people used the chatrooms, with some paying up to $1,200 (£1,000) for access.

item.title: Coronavirus: Calls to protect great apes from threat of infection
item.description: The possibility of infection in great apes like gorillas warrants the utmost caution, say experts.

item.title: Coronavirus: Bolsonaro downplays threat of pandemic to Brazil
item.description: The president describes restrictions to fight the virus in the country as a "scorched-earth" policy.

item.title: Coronavirus: Trump hopes US will shake off pandemic by Easter
item.description: As the president sets out "a beautiful timeline", New York warns it is a "canary in the coal mine".

item.title: Terrence McNally: Playwright dies of coronavirus complications
item.description: One of America's great playwrights, he wrote more than three dozen plays in his nearly 60-year career.

item.title: Coronavirus: How Covid-19 is denying dignity to the dead in Italy
item.description: Funerals have been banned in Italy - robbing many families of the chance to say a final goodbye.

item.title: India's poorest 'fear hunger may kill us before coronavirus'
item.description: Millions of Indians who rely on daily wages from jobs like cleaning risk running out of money.

item.title: Marini Naturals: The haircare business that reaches 12 countries
item.description: Michelle Ntalami couldn't buy the products she wanted for her hair, so she set up a company to sell them.

item.title: Coronavirus: How did Australia's Ruby Princess cruise debacle happen?
item.description: The Ruby Princess was allowed to unload 2,700 passengers in Sydney - now over 130 have coronavirus.

item.title: Celebrating a birthday party by video chat
item.description: With social distancing measures in place, many are adjusting to the new normal online.

item.title: Coronavirus in South America: How it became a class issue
item.description: Early cases involved wealthier people who have been abroad, but fears are growing for the poorest.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's young people's risk?
item.description: An 18-year-old has died of coronavirus in England. Are young people at risk from the virus?

item.title: Even more coronavirus myths to ignore
item.description: Reality Check tackles misleading health advice being shared online.

item.title: Stranded abroad as coronavirus closes borders
item.description: As global travel restrictions expand, hundreds of foreign nationals are struggling to return home.

item.title: Coronavirus: Yves Saint Laurent to make surgical masks
item.description: The Paris-based fashion brand's owners want to help the French health service fight Covid-19.

item.title: The volunteer army helping self-isolating neighbours
item.description: The coronavirus outbreak has left many feeling trapped indoors, but for some help may not be far away.

item.title: Coronavirus: Italian parcel delivery drivers rally in song
item.description: The workers sing as they pack parcels in Bergamo, Italy, one of the cities worst hit by coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus information: What should I do?
item.description: Step-by-step, what to do to help prevent the spread of the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Indians panic buy supplies ahead of lockdown
item.description: On Tuesday night Indians rushed to stockpile on supplies ahead of a sudden total lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: G20 'must step up for developing world'
item.description: UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres says the virus cannot be fought "in half of humanity" alone.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Look at us today... we are your future'
item.description: The New York governor says the city is a test case and that the first priority should be to save lives.

item.title: Coronavirus: Reopening the US by Easter 'a beautiful timeline'
item.description: President Trump says he wants to open the US for business again by Easter - the weekend of 12 April.

item.title: Ukraine's missing people amid ongoing conflict
item.description: Thousands of people have gone missing since the conflict started in 2014, according to the Red Cross.

item.title: Teen figure skater's Special Olympics dream
item.description: Thirteen-year-old Ornela has Down's syndrome and is training to compete in the World Games next year.
